item.title: 拜登在习近平峰会前会见印度尼西亚总统
item.description:
Leaders from the United States and Indonesia held discussions on Monday that will set the stage for U.S. President Joe Biden's first in person meeting in a year with Chinese leader Xi Jinping later this week.翻译:美国和印度尼西亚领导人周一举行了讨论，为本周晚些时候美国总统乔·拜登与中国领导人习近平一年内的首次会面奠定了基础。

Biden greeted Indonesian President Joko Widodo at the White House as the two leaders prepare for a Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC) summit in San Francisco, where Washington hopes to reduce friction with Beijing. Biden is due to meet Xi on Wednesday.翻译:拜登在白宫迎接印度尼西亚总统佐科·维多多，两国领导人正在筹备在旧金山举行的亚太经合组织（APEC）峰会，华盛顿希望减少与北京的摩擦。拜登定于周三与习近平会面。

The United States and Indonesia agreed to new cooperation in defense areas including cybersecurity, space, combined exercises and nuclear threats, the White House said. On climate, they agreed on efforts to support the electrical grid and improve air quality.翻译:白宫表示，美国和印度尼西亚同意在网络安全、太空、联合演习和核威胁等国防领域开展新的合作。在气候方面，他们同意努力支持电网和改善空气质量。

Reuters reported on Sunday that the two countries are working to advance a potential minerals partnership focused on the electric vehicle (EV) battery metal nickel, citing three people with direct knowledge of the conversations.翻译:路透社周日援引三名直接了解对话情况的人士的话报道称，两国正在努力推进潜在的矿物合作伙伴关系，重点关注电动汽车（EV）电池金属镍。

But the Biden administration is still concerned about environmental, social and governance (ESG) standards in Indonesia and is examining how such a deal might work. The two sides will unveil a plan that will prepare the countries for negotiations on the issue, one of the U.S. officials said.翻译:但拜登政府仍然对印度尼西亚的环境、社会和治理（ESG）标准感到担忧，并正在研究这样的协议如何运作。一位美国官员表示，双方将公布一项计划，为两国就此问题的谈判做好准备。

The White House said on Monday that Biden would announce a memorandum of understanding (MOU) between the two sides on sustainable energy and mineral development.

INDONESIA MAKES APPEAL TO U.S. ON GAZA

Jokowi, as the president is known, pressed Biden on steps to end Israel's war with Hamas.翻译:总统佐科威敦促拜登采取措施结束以色列与哈马斯的战争。

"Indonesia appeals to the U.S. to do more to stop the atrocities in Gaza. Ceasefire is a must for the sake of humanity," Widodo said in the Oval Office at the start of talks with the U.S. president.翻译:“印度尼西亚呼吁美国采取更多措施制止加沙的暴行。为了人类的利益，停火是必须的，”维多多在与美国总统会谈开始时在椭圆形办公室表示。

Indonesia, an archipelago of 270 million people, is the largest Muslim-majority nation. Many Muslims have been outraged by Biden's support for Israel after Hamas militants killed about 1,200 people and took more than 200 hostages on Oct. 7, according to Israeli officials. Palestinian officials have said Israeli strikes have killed more than 11,000 Gaza residents.翻译:印度尼西亚是一个拥有 2.7 亿人口的群岛国家，是最大的穆斯林占多数的国家。据以色列官员称，哈马斯武装分子于 10 月 7 日杀害了约 1,200 人并劫持了 200 多人质，之后许多穆斯林对拜登对以色列的支持感到愤怒。巴勒斯坦官员表示，以色列的空袭已造成超过 11,000 名加沙居民死亡。

"The president will look to ask Indonesia to a play a larger role and to assist us," in the Middle East, a U.S. official said, without elaborating on what such an expanded role might entail.翻译:一位美国官员表示，“总统将要求印度尼西亚发挥更大的作用并协助我们”，但他没有详细说明这种扩大的作用可能意味着什么。

Like several of its neighbors in Southeast Asia, Indonesia is economically intertwined with China as it navigates territorial disputes with its larger neighbor and wants to avoid getting caught in the middle by hostile Washington-Beijing relations.翻译:与东南亚的几个邻国一样，印度尼西亚在处理与其较大邻国的领土争端时与中国在经济上紧密相连，并希望避免因华盛顿与北京的敌对关系而陷入困境。

Jakarta and Washington formally upgraded relations to the highest diplomatic tier as part of the leaders' meeting.翻译:作为领导人会议的一部分，雅加达和华盛顿正式将关系提升至最高外交级别。

The two leaders were expected to discuss Indonesia's diplomatic efforts to resolve the conflict in Myanmar, where the military took control in a 2021 coup and has been engaged in clashes with rebel alliances, one of the officials said.翻译:一位官员表示，预计两位领导人将讨论印度尼西亚为解决缅甸冲突而做出的外交努力。缅甸军方在 2021 年的政变中控制了缅甸，并一直与叛军联盟发生冲突。

"It's going to be time soon for us to think about what our next steps are together to deal with a situation that is untenable," the person said.翻译:这位人士表示：“我们很快就会考虑下一步应该采取什么措施来应对这种难以维持的局面。”

Jokowi, first elected in 2014, is constitutionally required to leave office next year after serving the maximum two terms.翻译:佐科维于 2014 年首次当选，根据宪法规定，他必须在任期最多两届后于明年离任。

Reporting by Trevor Hunnicutt and Steve Holland; additional reporting by Jeff Mason; Editing by Michael Perry and Grant McCool翻译:特雷弗·亨尼卡特和史蒂夫·霍兰德报道；杰夫·梅森的补充报道；迈克尔·佩里和格兰特·麦库尔编辑

item.title: 朝鲜批评七国集团是“冷战的残余”
item.description:
North Korea criticised the Group of Seven countries as a "remnant of the Cold War" that causes conflicts for their own interests and violates other countries' sovereignty, its state media KCNA said on Tuesday.翻译:朝鲜官方媒体朝中社周二表示，朝鲜批评七国集团是“冷战残余”，为自身利益引发冲突，侵犯其他国家主权。

Jo Chol Su, director general of the Department of International Organisations at Pyongyang's foreign ministry, condemned G7 foreign ministers for "slandering" the country's exercise of "self-defensive and legitimate sovereignty" in a joint statement following a meeting last week in Tokyo.翻译:平壤外交部国际组织司司长赵哲洙上周在东京举行会议后发表联合声明，谴责七国集团外长“诽谤”朝鲜行使“自卫和合法主权”。

The joint statement by the G7 called for humanitarian pauses in the Israel-Hamas war, reaffirmed support for Ukraine in its war with Russia, and condemned North Korea's missile tests and arms transfers to Russia.翻译:七国集团的联合声明呼吁暂停以色列与哈马斯的战争，重申支持乌克兰与俄罗斯的战争，并谴责朝鲜的导弹试验和向俄罗斯转让武器。

"G7, which has caused and fomented the recent international crisis, says this or that to find fault with independent sovereign states," Jo said, according to KCNA.翻译:据朝中社报道，乔说：“引发和煽动最近国际危机的七国集团说这说那，是为了对独立主权国家挑衅。”

"G7 is just the main dangerous source of destroying global peace and security and the main stumbling block to the establishment of a just international order."翻译:“七国集团正是破坏全球和平与安全的主要危险源，也是建立公正国际秩序的主要绊脚石。”

The group can not represent the international community but protects a few countries' interests, Jo said, singling out the United States as a supplier of deadly weapons to Ukraine to "deliberately destroy peace and stability" in Europe.翻译:乔说，该组织不能代表国际社会，而是保护少数国家的利益，并指出美国是乌克兰致命武器的供应商，“蓄意破坏”欧洲的和平与稳定。

Jo also accused Washington of "conniving at and fomenting" military strikes at Gaza while "shielding Israel's hideous massacre of civilians."翻译:乔还指责华盛顿“纵容和煽动”对加沙的军事打击，同时“包庇以色列对平民的可怕屠杀”。

"It has lost the justification for its existence," Jo said. "G7, the remnant of the Cold War, should be dismantled immediately, and this will be the first step toward defusing the present international crisis and restoring global peace."翻译:“它已经失去了存在的理由，”乔说。 “冷战残余的七国集团应该立即解散，这是化解当前国际危机、恢复全球和平的第一步。”

The North Korean statement coincides with South Korea hosting representatives of 17 member states of the U.N. Command (UNC) enforcing the Korean War armistice. The talks on Tuesday where expected to renew a pledge to respond to any aggression by North Korea.翻译:朝鲜发表声明之际，韩国接待了执行朝鲜战争停战协定的联合国军司令部 (UNC) 17 个成员国的代表。周二的会谈预计将重申对朝鲜的任何侵略做出回应的承诺。

Reporting by Hyonhee Shin; Editing by Michael Perry翻译:申贤熙报道；迈克尔·佩里编辑

item.title: 台湾正致力于在亚太经合组织峰会上与拜登进行一对一会面
item.description:
Taiwan is working on securing a one-on-one meeting with U.S. President Joe Biden and the island's representative at this week's APEC summit in San Francisco, but there is no message planned for China, a senior Taiwanese official said.翻译:一位台湾高级官员表示，台湾正在努力确保在本周于旧金山举行的亚太经合组织峰会上与美国总统乔·拜登和台湾代表进行一对一会面，但没有计划向中国传达任何信息。

Chinese-claimed and democratically ruled Taiwan, which takes part in the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC) forum as "Chinese Taipei" and does not send its president to summits, has faced increased military pressure from Beijing, including two rounds of major war games during the past year and a half.翻译:中国声称实行民主统治的台湾以“中华台北”身份参加亚太经合组织（APEC）论坛，并且不派总统参加峰会，该国面临着来自北京的越来越大的军事压力，包括两轮重大战争过去一年半的比赛。

Wellington Koo, head of Taiwan's National Security Council, told reporters in Taipei that the government was aiming for a meeting between APEC envoy Morris Chang, the 92-year-old founder of chip giant TSMC (2330.TW), and Biden.翻译:台湾国家安全委员会主席顾维钧在台北对记者表示，政府的目标是让亚太经合组织特使、芯片巨头台积电(2330.TW)创始人、92岁的张忠谋与拜登举行会面。

"The two sides are discussing related arrangements," Koo said when asked whether Chang plans to hold an one-on-one meeting with Biden at APEC.翻译:当被问及张是否计划在亚太经合组织与拜登举行一对一会晤时，辜表示：“双方正在讨论相关安排。”

The White House did not respond to a request for comment.翻译:白宫没有回应置评请求。

The U.S. State Department said that it did not have anything to announce on "specific bilateral meetings" on the summit's sidelines, but that Biden looked forward to welcoming Taiwan's participation.翻译:美国国务院表示，对于峰会期间的“具体双边会议”没有任何消息可宣布，但拜登期待欢迎台湾的参与。

A senior Taiwan official familiar with the matter said that Taiwan had requested such a meeting with the U.S. leader in previous years at APEC, and that the arrangement depended on Biden's availability.翻译:一位知情的台湾高级官员表示，台湾曾在前几年的亚太经合组织会议上要求与美国领导人举行此类会晤，具体安排取决于拜登是否有空。

The United States, like most countries, has no formal ties with Taiwan, but it is the island's most important international backer and arms provider.翻译:与大多数国家一样，美国与台湾没有正式关系，但它是台湾最重要的国际支持者和武器提供者。

Tensions over Taiwan are likely to feature when Biden meets Chinese President Xi Jinping at the summit.翻译:当拜登在峰会上会见中国国家主席习近平时，台湾问题上的紧张局势可能会成为焦点。

Koo said Washington and Beijing were divided on major topics, including Taiwan.翻译:古说，华盛顿和北京在包括台湾在内的重大议题上存在分歧。

"They are fundamentally split on core issues, so the meeting could become a place where they talk past each other," he said, adding that on Taiwan, neither side is likely to make concessions.翻译:他说：“他们在核心问题上存在根本分歧，因此这次会议可能成为他们相互指责的地方。”他补充说，在台湾问题上，双方都不太可能做出让步。

He said, however, that the meeting is necessary because it would an opportunity for Washington to "manage risks" amid Sino-U.S. tensions.翻译:但他表示，这次会议是必要的，因为这将是华盛顿在中美紧张局势中“管理风险”的机会。

President Tsai Ing-wen said on Friday that Taiwan will stress the importance of regional peace at the summit, one of the few international bodies of both Taiwan and China are members and where their officials meet, even if just in passing or for pleasantries.翻译:蔡英文总统周五表示，台湾将在峰会上强调地区和平的重要性。峰会是台湾和中国大陆均为其成员的少数国际机构之一，也是两国官员会面的地方，即使只是顺便或寒暄。

Asked whether Chang had been tasked with greeting Xi and sending him a message from Tsai, Koo said "no".翻译:当被问及张是否负责迎接习近平并向他发送蔡英文的信息时，古说“没有”。

However, he added: "Everything should happen naturally."翻译:不过，他补充道：“一切都应该自然发生。”

Chang briefly met with Xi at last year's APEC summit in Bangkok, and discussed semiconductors with U.S. Vice President Kamala Harris.翻译:张在去年曼谷亚太经合组织峰会上与习近平进行了短暂会面，并与美国副总统卡马拉·哈里斯讨论了半导体问题。

China cut off a formal talks mechanism with Taiwan after Tsai first won office in 2016, believing her to be a separatist. Tsai says only Taiwan's people can decide the island's future and strongly rejects China's sovereignty claims.翻译:蔡英文2016年上台后，中国认为她是分裂分子，切断了与台湾的正式对话机制。蔡英文表示，只有台湾人民才能决定台湾的未来，并强烈反对中国的主权主张。

Reporting by Yimou Lee; Additional reporting by Ben Blanchard, and Michael Martina and Trevor Hunnicutt in Washington. Editing by Gerry Doyle翻译:李亦谋报道；本·布兰查德 (Ben Blanchard)、迈克尔·马丁纳 (Michael Martina) 和特雷弗·洪尼卡特 (Trevor Hunnicutt) 在华盛顿的补充报道。格里·多伊尔编辑

item.title: 中国习近平在美国商务晚宴上的菜单上有棘手的政治
item.description:
Top business leaders in the United States are expected to dine with Chinese President Xi Jinping in San Francisco on Wednesday as he seeks to court American companies and counter his country's recent struggles to entice foreign investment.翻译:美国高层商界领袖预计将于周三在旧金山与中国国家主席习近平共进晚餐，习近平寻求讨好美国公司，并应对中国最近在吸引外国投资方面的困难。

The dinner on the margins of the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC) forum will follow a day of talks between Xi and U.S. President Joe Biden, aimed at stabilizing fraught ties between the world's two largest economies.翻译:习近平和美国总统乔·拜登将在亚太经合组织（APEC）论坛间隙举行晚宴，会谈旨在稳定世界两大经济体之间紧张的关系。

For American businesses, it will be a chance to hear directly from China's leader as they search for ways to navigate China's economic slowdown, a U.S. push to "de-risk" some American supply chains away from China, and uncertainty caused by expanding Chinese security rules.翻译:对于美国企业来说，这将是一个直接听取中国领导人意见的机会，因为他们正在寻找应对中国经济放缓、美国推动部分美国供应链远离中国“降低风险”以及中国安全扩张带来的不确定性的方法。规则。

"The purpose of the dinner is to foster better communication," one source close to the organizers told Reuters, declining to say who would speak while confirming representatives from both the Chinese and U.S. governments would share the podium.翻译:一位与组织者关系密切的消息人士告诉路透社：“晚宴的目的是促进更好的沟通。”他拒绝透露谁将发言，但确认中国和美国政府的代表将共享讲台。

But the event, yet to be formally announced by hosts U.S.-China Business Council (USCBC) and the National Committee on U.S.-China Relations (NCUSCR), also presents uneasy optics.翻译:但这一活动尚未由主办方美中贸易全国委员会 (USCBC) 和美中关系全国委员会 (NCUSCR) 正式宣布，也呈现出令人不安的景象。

According to event notifications seen by Reuters, some U.S. firms will pay tens of thousands of dollars to hear a "Chinese state leader" from a government that Washington has accused of genocide against Muslim Uyghurs. China has vigorously denied the accusations.翻译:根据路透社看到的活动通知，一些美国公司将支付数万美元，以听取“中国国家领导人”的讲话，华盛顿指责该政府对穆斯林维吾尔人进行种族灭绝。中国坚决否认这些指控。

The USCBC and NCUSCR both declined to comment on the planned dinner. China's embassy in Washington did not respond to a request for comment.翻译:USCBC 和 NCUSCR 均拒绝对计划中的晚宴发表评论。中国驻华盛顿大使馆没有回应置评请求。

Xi, who is widely expected to deliver a speech, will be eager to convince U.S. industry that China is still open for business after recording its first quarterly deficit in foreign direct investment.翻译:人们普遍预计习近平将发表讲话，他将急于让美国业界相信，在外国直接投资首次出现季度赤字后，中国仍然对商业开放。

Even as China this year cast off COVID-19 pandemic controls that effectively shut its borders, it has grown more suspicious of engagement with Western companies, in line with Xi's emphasis on national security. Xi has overseen a crackdown on U.S. consultancy and due-diligence firms, a further blow to investor confidence.

'FILET MIGNON' AND HUMAN RIGHTS

For decades, business and trade has been at the center of U.S.-China relations, helping to fuel China's explosive economic resurgence and offering what Beijing has often described as the ballast in otherwise contentious ties.翻译:几十年来，商业和贸易一直是美中关系的核心，帮助推动了中国经济的爆炸性复苏，并为其他有争议的关系提供了北京经常所说的压舱石。

But concerns about a new style cold war between the rival economic and geopolitical superpowers has increasingly placed companies in the cross hairs of both governments.翻译:但对相互竞争的经济和地缘政治超级大国之间爆发新型冷战的担忧日益使企业成为两国政府的瞄准目标。

Xi is on his first visit to the U.S. in more than six years and the pricey dinner, up to $40,000 for a table of eight, according to one notice for the event, is routine by standards for past Chinese presidential visits.翻译:这是习近平六年多来首次访问美国，根据此次活动的一份通知，这场昂贵的晚餐高达八人桌高达 4 万美元，按照过去中国国家主席访问的标准来看，这是例行公事。

Reuters was not able to obtain a list of attendees, but executives of some companies who spoke privately to Reuters said they would steer clear given questions about the utility for their operations in China and U.S. political risks.翻译:路透社无法获得与会者名单，但一些公司高管私下向路透社表示，鉴于有关其在中国业务的实用性和美国政治风险的问题，他们将避开。

Jeff Moon, a former U.S. trade official turned business adviser, said China's goal would be to soften Xi's image and attract investment, but that the dinner was unlikely to "move any needles."翻译:前美国贸易官员、后来担任商业顾问的杰夫·穆恩表示，中国的目标是软化习近平的形象并吸引投资，但晚宴不太可能“起到任何作用”。

U.S. lawmakers have castigated some American businesses for turning a blind eye to allegations of forced labor in China and some have been scathing in their criticism of the event.翻译:美国议员严厉批评一些美国企业对中国强迫劳动的指控视而不见，一些企业对这一事件提出了严厉的批评。

"How does that dinner conversation go? 'Wow, this filet mignon is a little dry. How's your extrajudicial internment of over a million Uyghur Muslims going?" said Mike Gallagher, the Republican chair of the House of Representative's select committee on China.翻译:“晚餐谈话进行得怎么样？‘哇，这菲力牛排有点干。你们对超过一百万维吾尔族穆斯林的法外拘留进展如何了？’”众议院中国问题特别委员会的共和党主席迈克·加拉格尔 (Mike Gallagher) 表示。

Despite human rights concerns, Biden has made a diplomatic push to improve relations, which slid to what many analysts viewed as an all-time low after the U.S. shot down an alleged Chinese spy balloon in February.翻译:尽管存在人权问题，拜登仍采取外交努力改善两国关系，在美国二月份击落所谓的中国间谍气球后，两国关系跌至许多分析人士认为的历史最低点。

The Biden administration says communication at the highest level is essential to prevent competition veering into conflict, and in the interest of the global economy too.翻译:拜登政府表示，最高层的沟通对于防止竞争演变成冲突至关重要，也符合全球经济的利益。

Biden's Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen reiterated ahead of the APEC summit that while the U.S. sought to reduce its dependence on China in some areas, it did not seek broad economic decoupling.翻译:拜登的财政部长珍妮特·耶伦在亚太经合组织峰会前重申，虽然美国寻求减少在某些领域对中国的依赖，但并不寻求广泛的经济脱钩。

The dinner is Xi's "reassurance tour," and business leaders would look to him to set expectations for how foreign companies would be treated in China, said Nirav Patel, chief executive of consultancy The Asia Group.翻译:咨询公司亚洲集团(The Asia Group)首席执行官尼拉夫·帕特尔(Nirav Patel)表示，这次晚宴是习近平的“放心之旅”，商界领袖将期待他对外国公司在中国受到的待遇设定期望。

"They have come to accept that there's no substitute for hearing and seeing and observing what Xi Jinping is doing," said Patel. "Of course, there are some that want to be able to demonstrate that they are committed to China and their presence in these meetings demonstrates that."翻译:帕特尔说：“他们已经开始接受，没有什么可以替代聆听、亲眼目睹和观察习近平正在做的事情。” “当然，有些人希望能够表明他们对中国的承诺，他们出席这些会议就证明了这一点。”

Additional reporting by David Brunnstrom and Stephen Nellis, editing by Michelle Nichols and Lincoln Feast.翻译:大卫·布伦斯特罗姆和斯蒂芬·内利斯的补充报道，米歇尔·尼科尔斯和林肯·盛宴的编辑。

item.title: 日元跌至数十年低点使市场保持干预警惕
item.description:
The battered yen was stuck near a three-decade low against the dollar on Tuesday, struggling to find a floor as the Bank of Japan's (BOJ) ultra-easy monetary policy settings remained at odds with the prospect of higher-for-longer rates elsewhere.翻译:周二，日元兑美元汇率陷入近三年来的低点，由于日本央行（BOJ）的超宽松货币政策设置与其他地区长期较高利率的前景仍然不一致，日元兑美元汇率陷入困境，难以找到底部。 。

The Japanese currency similarly slumped to a 15-year low of 162.38 per euro in early Asia trade and slid to a roughly three-month trough of 186.25 per British pound .翻译:日元在亚洲早盘交易中同样跌至 15 年来的低点，兑欧元 162.38 美元，并跌至大约三个月低点，兑英镑 186.25 美元。

Against the dollar, the yen last stood at 151.72 , languishing near a one-year low of 151.92 hit on Monday. A break below last year's trough of 151.94 per dollar would mark a fresh 33-year low for the yen.翻译:日元兑美元最新报151.72，徘徊在周一触及的一年低点151.92附近。如果日元跌破去年151.94美元兑日元的低点，将创下日元新的33年低点。

The yen had jumped briefly against the greenback in New York hours on Monday after striking the year-to-date low, which analysts attributed to a flurry of trading in options that come due this week.翻译:周一纽约时段，日元兑美元汇率在触及今年以来的低点后短暂上涨，分析师将此归因于本周到期的一系列期权交易。

Despite the BOJ's carefully orchestrated steps to phase out its controversial yield curve control (YCC) policy and hints of an imminent end to negative interest rates, the piecemeal moves have done little to prop up the yen, particularly as central banks globally maintain their hawkish rhetoric of higher-for-longer rates.翻译:尽管日本央行精心策划了逐步取消颇具争议的收益率曲线控制（YCC）政策的举措，并暗示即将结束负利率，但这些零敲碎打的举措对支撑日元收效甚微，特别是在全球央行维持强硬言论的情况下更高的长期利率。

"I think the market has come to the realisation that the Bank of Japan is going to exit its policy but at a very, very, very slow and cautious pace," said Rodrigo Catril, senior FX strategist at National Australia Bank (NAB).翻译:澳大利亚国民银行（NAB）高级外汇策略师罗德里戈·卡特里尔（Rodrigo Catril）表示：“我认为市场已经意识到日本央行将退出其政策，但步伐非常非常缓慢且谨慎。”

"A weak yen is probably going to stay here for a little bit longer, and the market has been testing to see what the appetite is, particularly for the (Ministry of Finance) and the BOJ, to allow for weaker levels."翻译:“疲软的日元可能会持续一段时间，市场一直在测试人们的胃口，特别是（财政部）和日本央行，以允许疲软的水平。”

Japanese authorities in September last year intervened in the currency market to boost the yen for the first time since 1998, after a BOJ decision to maintain its ultra-loose monetary policy drove the yen as low as 145 per dollar.翻译:去年9月，日本央行决定维持超宽松货币政策，导致日元兑美元汇率跌至145美元以下，日本当局自1998年以来首次干预货币市场，提振日元汇率。

It intervened again in October 2022 after the yen plunged to a 32-year low of 151.94.

INFLATION AND THE FED

Outside of Asia, traders also had their attention on U.S. inflation figures due later on Tuesday, which will provide further clarity on whether the Federal Reserve would need to raise interest rates further to tame inflation.翻译:在亚洲之外，交易员还关注周二晚些时候公布的美国通胀数据，该数据将进一步明确美联储是否需要进一步加息以抑制通胀。

Fed Chair Jerome Powell and his chorus of policymakers have in recent days pushed back against market expectations that the U.S. central bank was done with its aggressive rate-hike cycle after it held rates steady at its latest policy meeting.翻译:美联储主席杰罗姆·鲍威尔和他的政策制定者们最近几天反驳了市场的预期，即美联储在最近一次政策会议上维持利率稳定后，已经结束了激进的加息周期。

The comments have kept the U.S. dollar bid, and the greenback rose marginally to 105.64 against a basket of currencies .翻译:该言论维持了美元买盘，美元兑一篮子货币小幅上涨至105.64。

Sterling steadied at $1.22775, while the euro last bought $1.0701, having largely traded sideways over the past few sessions.翻译:英镑稳定在 1.22775 美元，而欧元最后买入 1.0701 美元，过去几个交易日基本呈横盘整理。

The New Zealand dollar languished near a one-week low and last stood at $0.5879.翻译:新西兰元兑美元跌至一周低点附近，最新报 0.5879 美元。

"Overall, the market is also kind of worn out by all messages coming from central banks and the higher-for-longer and wait-and-see mode is keeping volatility low," said NAB's Catril.翻译:国民银行的卡特里尔表示：“总体而言，市场也因来自央行的所有消息而感到疲倦，而长期走高和观望模式使波动性保持在较低水平。”

"We need to wait for that CPI number tonight, which could be a bit of a shaker. If it's strong, then obviously it brings in the idea that another rate hike from the Fed is there."翻译:“我们需要等待今晚的消费者物价指数（CPI）数据，这可能会有点震撼。如果它强劲，那么显然它会带来美联储将再次加息的想法。”

Down Under, the Australian dollar edged 0.03% higher to $0.63785.翻译:在澳大利亚，澳元兑美元小幅上涨 0.03%，至 0.63785 美元。

A survey on Tuesday showed Australian business conditions held firm in October even as confidence slipped a little, a resilience that will be tested by higher borrowing costs following a rise in official interest rates last week.翻译:周二的一项调查显示，尽管信心略有下滑，但澳大利亚 10 月份商业状况依然坚挺，上周官方利率上升后借贷成本上升将考验这种韧性。

Reporting by Rae Wee. Editing by Sam Holmes翻译:雷威报道。山姆·霍姆斯编辑

item.title: 中国毕业生推迟职业梦想，从事临时政府工作
item.description:
Having failed to find his dream job at a Chinese internet company upon graduation, Peter Liu settled for a role in a state library where there is so little need for his participation that he spends his time studying for a change in his career path.翻译:毕业后，彼得·刘(Peter Liu)未能在一家中国互联网公司找到自己梦想的工作，他最终在一家州立图书馆找到了一份工作，那里几乎不需要他参与，所以他把时间花在了学习上，以期改变自己的职业道路。

"It's really hard to get work at big companies," said the 24-year-old who majored in TV production at a Beijing university before moving back home in the central Henan province.翻译:“在大公司找到工作真的很难，”这位 24 岁的年轻人说，他在北京一所大学主修电视制作，后来搬回了位于中部河南省的老家。

Liu got the librarian job after a government-led campaign to secure temporary work for graduates, which analysts describe as a short-term solution to preserve social stability in a slowing economy with little on offer for young Chinese.翻译:刘在政府主导的一场为毕业生争取临时工作的运动后获得了图书馆员的职位，分析人士称，这是在经济放缓、中国年轻人几乎没有什么机会的情况下维护社会稳定的短期解决方案。

Such "welfare jobs," as they are known in China, include roles as receptionists, office administrators, security guards and community workers. Various government institutions offer such jobs every year, but they had usually drawn applications from disadvantaged groups, such as elderly or disabled people.翻译:这些在中国被称为“福利工作”的岗位包括接待员、办公室管理员、保安和社区工作人员。各个政府机构每年都会提供此类工作，但通常都是从弱势群体（例如老年人或残疾人）中吸引申请。

This year, amid a deepening youth joblessness crisis in the world's second-largest economy, even remote rural positions have seen intense competition from young Chinese with diplomas from top universities, graduates and economists say.翻译:毕业生和经济学家表示，今年，在世界第二大经济体青年失业危机日益加深的情况下，即使是偏远的农村职位也面临着来自拥有顶尖大学文凭的中国年轻人的激烈竞争。

The government sees employment as key to pacifying China's most pessimistic generation in decades, while graduates gaining even limited work experience can also benefit their future employers if the economy recovers, analysts say.翻译:分析人士表示，政府认为就业是安抚中国数十年来最悲观一代的关键，而如果经济复苏，即使毕业生获得有限的工作经验也能让他们未来的雇主受益。

The one-to-three year contracts pay roughly the minimum wage in the region, typically between 2,000 and 3,000 yuan ($275-$412) per month, sometimes including free meals - much less than their average expectation for a first job salary of 8,033 yuan, according to a survey by Chinese recruitment firm Liepin.翻译:一到三年的合同支付的工资大致相当于该地区的最低工资，通常为每月 2,000 至 3,000 元（275 至 412 美元），有时包括免费餐 - 远低于他们对第一份工作 8,033 元的平均预期工资根据中国招聘公司猎聘的一项调查。

A separate programme aiming for 1 million internships this year has courted state-owned and private firms for participation.翻译:一项旨在今年提供 100 万个实习机会的单独计划吸引了国有和私营公司参与。

The Ministry of Human Resources and Social Security, which did not reply to a request for comment on the government programmes or the job market, told state media last week youth employment was improving.翻译:人力资源和社会保障部没有回复对政府计划或就业市场发表评论的请求，但上周对官方媒体表示，青年就业正在改善。

China has in the past year eased some regulatory burdens on tech, property and finance firms - traditionally large employers of new talent. But state media editorials have also encouraged young graduates to take lower skilled jobs.翻译:去年，中国减轻了科技、房地产和金融公司的一些监管负担，这些公司历来是新人才的大雇主。但官方媒体的社论也鼓励年轻毕业生从事技术含量较低的工作。

On Wednesday, the statistics bureau is expected to omit for the fourth consecutive month the release of youth unemployment data, suspended in July after reaching a record 21.3% in June, just as 11.6 million fresh graduates were entering the job market.翻译:周三，预计统计局将连续第四个月省略青年失业率数据的发布，该数据在 6 月份达到创纪录的 21.3% 后于 7 月份暂停发布，当时正值 1,160 万应届毕业生进入就业市场。

The total take-up of short-term jobs and internships remains unknown, but social media posts commenting on the selection process and discussing career options are frequent and analysts expect such roles will be in demand in a slowing economy.翻译:短期工作和实习的总人数仍不得而知，但社交媒体上经常出现评论甄选过程和讨论职业选择的帖子，分析师预计，在经济放缓的情况下，此类职位将会很受欢迎。

Still, the state sector - which provides a fifth of the urban jobs in China - can only temporarily alleviate economic pressure for a portion of university graduates through such campaigns, economists say, warning youth unemployment remains a major long-term headache for Beijing.翻译:尽管如此，经济学家表示，国有部门——提供了中国五分之一的城镇就业机会——只能通过此类运动暂时缓解部分大学毕业生的经济压力，并警告说，青年失业问题仍然是令北京方面长期头疼的一个主要问题。

"Youth unemployment will stay with us for quite a long time, at least for five-to-10 years," said Wang Jun, chief economist at Huatai Asset Management, adding the temporary jobs are "a short-term fix for stability, to relieve social conflicts brought by joblessness."翻译:华泰资产管理公司首席经济学家王军表示：“青年失业问题将在相当长的一段时间内困扰我们，至少会持续五到十年。”他补充说，临时就业岗位是“稳定稳定的短期解决方案”。缓解失业带来的社会矛盾。”

China had witnessed high youth unemployment in the late 1970s and early 1980s as educated youth returned to cities after working the farmlands under Mao Zedong, as well as in the late 1990s when the country began shrinking inefficient state conglomerates.翻译:在20世纪70年代末和1980年代初，随着知青在毛泽东领导下的农田工作后返回城市，以及在90年代末，当中国开始收缩效率低下的国有企业时，中国青年失业率居高不下。

A 23-year-old graduate surnamed Chen said she beat more than a dozen applicants in August to a secretary job at a local agriculture centre in the southwestern city of Chongqing.翻译:一名 23 岁的陈姓毕业生表示，8 月份，她击败了十几名应聘者，在西南部城市重庆的当地农业中心找到了一份秘书工作。

"The gap between my dreams and reality is huge," said Chen, who wanted to become a teacher.翻译:“我的梦想和现实之间的差距很大，”想成为一名教师的陈说。

Chen and Liu are both using the slow days at work to study for the highly-competitive 2024 civil service exam, which drew a record 2.6 million applicants, according to state media. If they pass, they would start on one of the most coveted career paths in China, often referred to as the "iron bowl" of financial stability.翻译:据官方媒体报道，陈和刘都在利用工作中的空闲时间来学习竞争激烈的 2024 年公务员考试，这次考试吸引了创纪录的 260 万人报名。如果通过，他们将开始中国最令人向往的职业道路之一，通常被称为金融稳定的“铁碗”。

Liu never expected to go for a public sector career, but for now he is at least happy that he can take that chance.翻译:刘从未想过会从事公共部门的职业，但现在他至少很高兴自己能抓住这个机会。

"I don't want my parents to see me staying at home all day with nothing to do," said Liu.翻译:“我不想让父母看到我整天呆在家里无所事事，”刘说。

($1 = 7.2851 Chinese yuan renminbi)翻译:（1 美元 = 7.2851 人民币）

item.title: 布林肯与英国新任外交大臣讨论以色列、乌克兰和中国
item.description:
U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken and newly appointed British foreign minister David Cameron discussed the Israel-Hamas conflict, relations with China and help for Ukraine during a telephone call on Monday, the State Department said.翻译:美国国务院表示，美国国务卿安东尼·布林肯和新任英国外交大臣戴维·卡梅伦周一通电话，讨论了以色列与哈马斯冲突、与中国的关系以及对乌克兰的帮助。

"Secretary Blinken and Lord Cameron underscored continuity in the U.S.-UK special relationship and its importance to regional and global security," State Department spokesperson Matthew Miller said in a readout of the conversation.翻译:美国国务院发言人马修·米勒在谈话内容中表示：“布林肯国务卿和卡梅伦勋爵强调了美英特殊关系的连续性及其对地区和全球安全的重要性。”

item.title: 拜登和中国习近平将在亚太经合组织峰会上讨论沟通和竞争
item.description:
The White House said on Monday President Joe Biden and Chinese President Xi Jinping will discuss strengthening communication and managing competition when they meet on the sidelines of the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC) summit this week.翻译:白宫周一表示，美国总统乔·拜登和中国国家主席习近平本周将在亚太经合组织（APEC）峰会期间会面，讨论加强沟通和管理竞争的问题。

The face-to-face meeting in the San Francisco Bay Area on Wednesday will be the first between Biden and Xi in a year, with the high-stakes diplomacy aimed at curbing tensions between the two superpowers.翻译:周三在旧金山湾区举行的面对面会晤将是拜登和习近平一年来的首次会面，此次高风险外交旨在遏制两个超级大国之间的紧张关系。

White House national security adviser Jake Sullivan told reporters Biden believes there is no substitute for face-to-face diplomacy to manage the complex relationship.翻译:白宫国家安全顾问杰克·沙利文告诉记者，拜登认为，在处理复杂的关系方面，面对面的外交是无可替代的。

"We anticipate that the leaders will discuss some of the most fundamental elements of the U.S.-PRC bilateral relationship, including the continued importance of strengthening open lines of communication and managing competition responsibly so that it does not veer into conflict," Sullivan said, referring to the People's Republic of China.翻译:沙利文表示：“我们预计领导人将讨论美中双边关系的一些最基本要素，包括加强开放的沟通渠道和负责任地管理竞争以使其不会演变成冲突的持续重要性。”至中华人民共和国。

"The way we achieve that is through intense diplomacy. That's how we clear up misperceptions and avoid surprises."翻译:“我们实现这一目标的方法是通过激烈的外交。这就是我们消除误解并避免意外的方法。”

Sullivan said Biden would go into the summit "on a solid footing," having positioned the United States to be able to compete effectively at home and abroad and with "the strongest recovery and lowest inflation of any leading economy."翻译:沙利文表示，拜登将以“坚实的基础”参加峰会，使美国能够在国内外进行有效竞争，并实现“所有主要经济体中最强劲的复苏和最低的通胀”。

He said Washington is looking for specific outcomes from the meeting and hoped to see progress in reestablishing military-to military ties with China and in combating the trade in fentanyl that has become a scourge in the United States.翻译:他表示，华盛顿正在寻求此次会议的具体成果，并希望看到在与中国重建军事关系以及打击已成为美国祸害的芬太尼贸易方面取得进展。

China cut off military-to-military communications with the United States last year after a visit to Taiwan, a democratically governed island China claims as its own, by then U.S. House speaker Nancy Pelosi. Tense relations soured further when the U.S. shot down U.S. spy balloon In February.翻译:去年，时任美国众议院议长南希·佩洛西访问台湾后，中国切断了与美国的军事联系。台湾是一个民主治理的岛屿，中国声称拥有自己的岛屿。当美国二月份击落美国间谍气球后，紧张关系进一步恶化。

Sullivan said communication between the militaries was the way to ensure competition did not veer into conflict and that China had been "constructive" on the issue in dialogue leading up to the summit.翻译:沙利文表示，军方之间的沟通是确保竞争不会演变成冲突的方式，并且中国在峰会前的对话中对此问题表现出“建设性”态度。

"We will see what happens in San Francisco and the President will be able to report after the meeting, whether in fact, we've made progress on restoring military-to-military links," he said.翻译:他说：“我们将看看旧金山会发生什么，总统将能够在会后报告，我们是否在恢复军事联系方面确实取得了进展。”

Biden and Xi have known each other for more than a decade and have shared hours of conversation over six interactions since Biden's 2021 inauguration.翻译:拜登和习近平已经相识十多年，自拜登 2021 年就职以来，双方已进行了六次互动，进行了数小时的交谈。

However, they have met only once in person since then and Xi has not visited the United States since 2017. Analysts and officials say they will come to the table in an atmosphere of mutual suspicion and garbled impressions of what the other is seeking.翻译:然而，自那以后，他们只见过一次面，而习近平自 2017 年以来就没有访问过美国。分析人士和官员表示，他们将在相互猜疑的气氛中进行会谈，并对对方的追求产生错误的印象。

The meeting is also expected to cover global issues from the Israel-Hamas war to Russia's invasion of Ukraine, North Korea's ties with Russia, Taiwan, human rights, artificial intelligence, as well as "fair" trade and economic relations, senior Biden administration officials said.翻译:拜登政府高级官员预计，此次会议还将涵盖以色列与哈马斯战争、俄罗斯入侵乌克兰、朝鲜与俄罗斯的关系、台湾、人权、人工智能以及“公平”贸易和经济关系等全球问题。说。

Sullivan said Biden would raise stability across the Middle East, adding that Beijing should share an interest in de-escalation there.翻译:沙利文表示，拜登将提高整个中东地区的稳定，并补充说，北京应该对缓和那里的局势感兴趣。

Biden would make the point that Iran acting in an "escalatory, destabilizing way" was not in the interests of China, he said. "And the PRC, of course, has a relationship with Iran, and it's capable, if it chooses, to of making those points directly to the Iranian government."翻译:他说，拜登将指出伊朗以“升级、破坏稳定的方式”行事不符合中国的利益。 “当然，中华人民共和国与伊朗有关系，如果它愿意的话，它有能力直接向伊朗政府提出这些观点。”

Leaders from the 21-member APEC forum are due to gather in San Francisco from Wednesday until Friday and the wars in the Middle East and Ukraine have divided opinion among them.翻译:由 21 个成员组成的亚太经合组织论坛的领导人定于周三至周五齐聚旧金山，中东和乌克兰的战争使他们意见分歧。

The senior U.S. official for APEC, Matt Murray, told reporters on Monday that the U.S. was working hard to try to get a strong consensus statement from the leaders, but analysts say the divisions make drafting this difficult.翻译:美国亚太经合组织高级官员马特·默里周一对记者表示，美国正在努力争取领导人达成强有力的共识声明，但分析人士表示，分歧使得起草过程变得困难。

Sullivan said that at APEC Biden would put forward his economic vision for the region and speak about "how the United States is the preeminent driver of inclusive, sustainable economic growth in the Asia Pacific."翻译:沙利文表示，拜登将在亚太经合组织上提出他对该地区的经济愿景，并谈到“美国如何成为亚太地区包容性、可持续经济增长的卓越推动者”。

item.title: 参议员要求财政部禁止中国电池公司和矿产参与美国电动汽车税收抵免
item.description:
Democratic Senator Joe Manchin urged the U.S. Treasury on Monday to adopt the "strictest possible standards" to prevent Chinese-produced minerals or Chinese battery companies from winning electric vehicle tax credits.翻译:民主党参议员乔·曼钦周一敦促美国财政部采取“尽可能严格的标准”，以阻止中国生产的矿物或中国电池公司获得电动汽车税收抵免。

Manchin, who chairs the Senate Energy Committee, raised concerns in a letter to Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen about reports Chinese battery companies are actively pursuing business opportunities to take advantage of the credits, adding U.S. tax credits "cannot be allowed to be hijacked by adversaries engaging in mineral laundering."翻译:参议院能源委员会主席曼钦在致财政部长珍妮特·耶伦的一封信中对中国电池公司正在积极寻求商机以利用税收抵免的报道表示担忧，并补充说美国税收抵免“不能被对手劫持”在洗矿过程中。”

In 2022, Congress passed the Inflation Reduction Act barring $7,500 in future consumer EV tax credits if any battery components are manufactured or assembled by a "foreign entity of concern."翻译:2022 年，国会通过了《通货膨胀削减法案》，如果任何电池组件是由“相关外国实体”制造或组装的，则未来的消费者电动汽车税收抵免将被禁止 7,500 美元。

The rules were aimed at weaning U.S. battery supply chains away from China, which Manchin noted is currently responsible for 74% of the world’s cathode production, 92% of anode production, and 76% of lithium-ion battery cell production.翻译:这些规则旨在使美国电池供应链脱离中国，曼钦指出，中国目前占全球正极产量的 74%、负极产量的 92% 和锂离子电池产量的 76%。

The auto industry awaiting detailed guidance from the Treasury on what is considered a "foreign entity of concern" as they make investment decisions on producing batteries for their transition to electric vehicles.翻译:汽车行业在做出向电动汽车过渡的电池生产投资决策时，正在等待财政部关于“受关注外国实体”的详细指导。

The foreign entity of concern rules come into effect in 2024 for completed batteries and 2025 for critical minerals used to produce them. The Treasury did not immediately comment.翻译:外国实体关注规则对于成品电池将于 2024 年生效，对于用于生产电池的关键矿物则于 2025 年生效。财政部没有立即发表评论。

Manchin said the law does not allow for a "value added test" exception and it "would be unconscionable to reward bad actors through a loose or deliberately weak interpretation."翻译:曼钦表示，法律不允许“增值测试”例外，“通过宽松或故意薄弱的解释来奖励不良行为者是不合理的”。

A key decision in the guidance is whether Ford Motor Co's (F.N) deal to license the technology of Chinese battery manufacturer CATL (300750.SZ) for use in Ford-owned U.S. battery plants will meet the Treasury's standards to access the tax credits. The arrangement has raised concerns among U.S. lawmakers.翻译:该指南的一个关键决定是，福特汽车公司（FN）授权中国电池制造商CATL （300750.SZ）技术用于福特旗下美国电池工厂的交易是否符合财政部获得税收抵免的标准。这一安排引起了美国立法者的担忧。

Ford put its planned $3.5 billion Michigan battery plant on hold in September and said it was awaiting "final language" from the Treasury on whether batteries made using Chinese technology will qualify for tax credits.翻译:福特9月份搁置了其计划投资35亿美元的密歇根电池工厂，并表示正在等待财政部关于使用中国技术制造的电池是否有资格获得税收抵免的“最终语言”。

Manchin said Yellen should "use the strictest metrics possible to ensure there are no loopholes that will lead to the laundering of minerals and materials from China or other nations of concern."翻译:曼钦表示，耶伦应该“使用尽可能严格的衡量标准，以确保不存在导致中国或其他相关国家的矿物和材料被洗钱的漏洞。”

Reporting by David Shepardson; Editing by Chris Reese and Jonathan Oatis翻译:大卫·谢泼德森报道；克里斯·里斯和乔纳森·奥蒂斯编辑

item.title: 甘表示，中国工商银行因黑客扰乱美国国债市场而支付了赎金
item.description:
China's biggest lender, the Industrial and Commercial Bank of China, paid a ransom after it was hacked last week, a Lockbit ransomware gang representative said on Monday in a statement which Reuters was unable to independently verify.翻译:Lockbit 勒索软件团伙代表周一在一份声明中表示，中国最大的银行中国工商银行在上周遭到黑客攻击后支付了赎金，但路透社无法独立核实该声明。

ICBC, whose U.S. arm was hit by a ransomware attack that disrupted trades in the U.S. Treasury market on Nov. 9, did not immediately respond to a request for comment.翻译:11月9日，中国工商银行美国分行遭受勒索软件攻击，美国国债市场交易中断，该行没有立即回应置评请求。

"They paid a ransom, deal closed," the Lockbit representative told Reuters via Tox, an online messaging app.翻译:Lockbit 代表通过在线消息应用程序 Tox 告诉路透社：“他们支付了赎金，交易完成。”

The blackout at ICBC's U.S. broker-dealer left it temporarily owing BNY Mellon BK.N $9 billion, an amount many times larger than its net capital.翻译:工商银行美国经纪自营商停电使其暂时欠纽约梅隆银行 (BK.N) 90 亿美元，这一数额是其净资本的数倍。

The hack was so extensive that even corporate email at the firm ceased to function, forcing employees to switch to Google mail, Reuters reported.翻译:据路透社报道，这次黑客攻击的范围如此之大，以至于该公司的企业电子邮件都停止运行，迫使员工改用谷歌邮件。

"The market is mostly back to normal now," said Zhiwei Ren, a portfolio manager at Penn Mutual Asset Management.翻译:佩恩互惠资产管理公司投资组合经理任志伟表示：“市场现在基本恢复正常。”

The ransomware attack came at a time of heightened worries about the resiliency of the $26 trillion Treasury market, essential to the plumbing of global finance, and is likely to draw scrutiny from regulators.翻译:此次勒索软件攻击发生之际，人们对 26 万亿美元的国债市场的弹性更加担忧，该市场对于全球金融管道至关重要，并且可能会引起监管机构的审查。

A spokesperson for the U.S. Treasury Department did not immediately provide comment on Monday.翻译:美国财政部发言人周一没有立即发表评论。

The Financial Services Information Sharing and Analysis Center, a financial industry cybersecurity group, said financial firms have well-established protocols for sharing information on such incidents.翻译:金融业网络安全组织金融服务信息共享和分析中心表示，金融公司拥有完善的协议来共享此类事件的信息。

"We are reminding members to stay current on all protective measures and patch critical vulnerabilities immediately," a spokesperson said in a statement, adding: "Ransomware remains one of the top threat vectors facing the financial sector."

WHY PAY?

Lockbit has hacked some of the world's largest organisations in recent months, stealing and leaking sensitive data in cases where victims refused to pay ransom.翻译:近几个月来，Lockbit 对世界上一些最大的组织进行了黑客攻击，在受害者拒绝支付赎金的情况下窃取和泄露敏感数据。

In just three years, it has become the world's top ransomware threat, according to U.S. officials.翻译:据美国官员称，在短短三年内，它已成为全球最大的勒索软件威胁。

Nowhere has it been more disruptive than in the United States, hitting more than 1,700 American organisations in nearly every sector from financial services and food to schools, transportation and government departments.翻译:没有哪个地方比美国更具破坏性，影响了从金融服务、食品到学校、交通和政府部门等几乎各个领域的 1,700 多个美国组织。

Authorities have long advised against paying ransomware gangs in a bid to break the criminals' business model. Ransom is usually demanded in the form of cryptocurrency, which is harder to trace and gives the receiver anonymity.翻译:当局长期以来一直建议不要向勒索软件团伙支付费用，以打破犯罪分子的商业模式。赎金通常以加密货币的形式提出，这种形式更难以追踪，并且可以让接收者匿名。

Some companies have quietly paid up in a bid to get back online quickly and avoid the reputational damage of having their sensitive data publicly leaked. Victims who do not have digital backups that allow them to restore their systems without the need of a decryption key sometimes have no choice but to pay.翻译:一些公司已经悄悄付款，以求尽快恢复正常运营，并避免因敏感数据公开泄露而造成声誉受损。没有数字备份而无需解密密钥即可恢复系统的受害者有时别无选择，只能付费。

Last week, Lockbit hackers published internal data from aerospace giant Boeing BA.N and said on their website they had infected computer systems at law firm Allen & Overy.翻译:上周，Lockbit 黑客公布了航空航天巨头波音 BA.N 的内部数据，并 在其网站上表示，他们已经感染了 Allen & Overy 律师事务所的计算机系统。

Reporting by James Pearson in London; Additional reporting by Davide Barbuscia, Carolina Mandl and Tatiana Bautzer in New York, and Pete Schroeder in Washington DC; Editing by Michelle Price, David Goodman, Jonathan Oatis and Alexander Smith翻译:詹姆斯·皮尔森在伦敦的报道； Davide Barbuscia、Carolina Mandl 和 Tatiana Bautzer 在纽约以及 Pete Schroeder 在华盛顿特区的补充报道；编辑：米歇尔·普莱斯、大卫·古德曼、乔纳森·奥蒂斯和亚历山大·史密斯

item.title: 波音股价因中国可能解除 737 订单冻结、迪拜订单激增而上涨
item.description:
Shares of Boeing (BA.N) rose on Monday after a report said China was considering ending its freeze on purchases of the planemaker's best-selling 737 MAX aircraft after more than four years.翻译:波音公司(BA.N)股价周一上涨，此前有报道称，中国正在考虑结束四年多以来对该飞机制造商最畅销 737 MAX 飞机的采购冻结。

This, coupled with bumper jet orders from Middle Eastern airlines at the Dubai Airshow, sent Boeing shares up 4%. Supplier Spirit Aerosystems (SPR.N) also rose 2.7%.翻译:再加上中东航空公司在迪拜航展上获得大量飞机订单，波音股价上涨 4%。供应商 Spirit Aerosystems (SPR.N)也上涨 2.7%。

China is considering resuming purchases of Boeing's 737 MAX aircraft when the U.S. and Chinese presidents meet this week at the APEC summit, Bloomberg News reported on Sunday, citing people familiar with the matter.翻译:彭博新闻周日援引知情人士的话报道称，中国正在考虑在美国和中国国家元首本周在亚太经合组织峰会上会晤时恢复购买波音 737 MAX 飞机。

The resumption of 737 orders from China would be meaningful to Boeing's bottom line over the next six to 18 months, said Thomas Hayes, chairman of hedge fund Great Hill Capital.翻译:对冲基金 Great Hill Capital 董事长托马斯·海耶斯 (Thomas Hayes) 表示，中国恢复 737 订单将对波音未来 6 至 18 个月的盈利产生重大影响。

Deliveries of Boeing's bestselling 737 MAX to Chinese airlines were halted following two deadly crashes.翻译:在发生两起致命空难后，波音最畅销的 737 MAX 飞机已停止向中国航空公司交付。

Boeing also secured orders for 125 widebody jets worth more than $50 billion from Emirates and its sister airline flydubai at the opening of the Dubai Airshow on Monday.翻译:波音公司还在周一迪拜航展开幕式上从阿联酋航空及其姊妹航空公司迪拜航空获得了价值超过 500 亿美元的 125 架宽体飞机订单。

Demand for the industry's biggest jets that dominated the region's airports is humming after a prolonged cyclical downturn followed by the damaging effect of COVID-19 on long-haul travel.翻译:在经历了长期的周期性低迷以及新冠肺炎 (COVID-19) 对长途旅行的破坏性影响之后，对该地区机场主导的业界最大喷气式飞机的需求正在蓬勃发展。

Carriers have been placing orders with urgency as planemakers' backlogs have grown and as jet deliveries have been pushed out toward the end of the decade.翻译:由于飞机制造商的积压订单不断增加，而且喷气式飞机的交付时间被推迟到本世纪末，航空公司一直在紧急下订单。

"Potential reopening of the 737 in China for Boeing and the contracts at the Dubai Airshow is all kind of the perfect combination of optimism and positive outlook that the stock has been needing for many months where it has underperformed," Hayes added.翻译:海耶斯补充道：“波音公司在中国重新开放 737 飞机的可能性以及迪拜航展上的合同都是乐观情绪和积极前景的完美结合，而这正是该股几个月来表现不佳所需要的。”

Boeing shares were trading at $205.15, compared with analysts' current median price target of $250, according to LSEG data.翻译:根据 LSEG 的数据，波音股价目前交易价格为 205.15 美元，而分析师目前的目标中值目标价为 250 美元。

Reporting by Shivansh Tiwary and Ananya Mariam Rajesh in Bengaluru; Editing by Shilpi Majumdar翻译:Shivansh Tiwary 和 Ananya Mariam Rajesh 在班加罗尔的报道；希尔皮·马宗达尔编辑

item.title: 美国商务部长雷蒙多将在APEC期间会见中国商务部长王毅
item.description:
The commerce chiefs of the United States and China will meet at the Asia Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC) forum this week, one of a series of cabinet-level engagements surrounding high-stakes talks between U.S. President Joe Biden and Chinese President Xi Jinping.翻译:美国和中国商务主管将于本周在亚太经济合作组织（APEC）论坛上会面，这是围绕美国总统乔·拜登和中国国家主席习近平之间的高风险会谈举行的一系列内阁级活动之一。

A U.S. Commerce Department spokesperson confirmed that U.S. Commerce Secretary Gina Raimondo and Chinese Commerce Minister Wang Wentao planned to meet but was not able to provide details and timing.翻译:美国商务部发言人证实，美国商务部长吉娜·雷蒙多和中国商务部部长王文涛计划会面，但未能提供细节和时间。

Raimondo is participating in ministerial meetings for APEC and the Biden administration's Indo-Pacific Economic Framework discussions.翻译:雷蒙多正在参加亚太经合组织部长级会议和拜登政府的印太经济框架讨论。

Biden and Xi are expected to meet in the San Francisco Bay area on Wednesday in an effort to calm a tense relationship between the world's two largest economies.翻译:拜登和习近平预计将于周三在旧金山湾区会面，以缓和世界最大两个经济体之间的紧张关系。

Raimondo first mentioned the meeting with Wang, their third in person in less than six months, in an interview with CNN that aired on Sunday.翻译:雷蒙多在周日播出的美国有线电视新闻网采访中首次提到了与王的会面，这是他们在不到六个月内的第三次会面。

She said it was time to "ratchet down the temperature" of the U.S.-China relationship. She added that she would not "sugarcoat anything, not to pretend that this isn't a great competition, but to be direct and be honest and also to ... responsibly manage this relationship."翻译:她表示，现在是美中关系“降温”的时候了。她补充说，她不会“粉饰一切，也不会假装这不是一场伟大的竞争，而是要直接、诚实，并且……负责任地管理这种关系。”

Her meeting with Wang follows U.S. Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen's meetings last week with Chinese Vice Premier He Lifeng, during which the two sides agreed to "intensify communication" - including with a return trip for Yellen to China next year.翻译:在她与王的会面之前，美国财政部长珍妮特·耶伦上周与中国国务院副总理何立峰会面，双方同意“加强沟通” ，包括耶伦明年重返中国。

Raimondo has a more difficult China portfolio than Yellen, as Commerce oversees contentious U.S. export controls on advanced semiconductors and chip manufacturing equipment, and other sensitive technologies that could have military applications. She said there can be "no negotiation" over these.翻译:雷蒙多在中国的投资组合比耶伦更为困难，因为商务部负责监督美国对先进半导体和芯片制造设备以及其他可能具有军事应用的敏感技术的有争议的出口管制。她表示，对于这些问题“没有任何谈判”。

During her visit to Beijing in late August, during which she met with Wang, Raimondo agreed to set up a dialogue with Chinese officials on export controls to avoid misunderstandings about the measures.翻译:8月下旬访问北京期间，雷蒙多会见了王毅，同意与中国官员就出口管制问题进行对话，以避免对这些措施产生误解。

She also said during the trip that U.S. businesses had told her that China was becoming "uninvestible" for U.S. firms. She repeated the comment to CNN, citing China's new anti-espionage law, unpredictable regulations and government raids on U.S. firms.翻译:她还表示，在访问期间，美国企业告诉她，中国对于美国企业来说正变得“无法投资” 。她向美国有线电视新闻网（CNN）重复了这一评论，并列举了中国新的反间谍法、不可预测的法规以及政府对美国公司的突击搜查。

Reporting by David Lawder; editing by Grant McCool翻译:大卫·劳德报道；格兰特·麦库尔编辑
item.author: David Lawder

item.title: 欧盟同意矿产供应目标以减少对中国的依赖
item.description:
Summary:
  • Critical minerals law likely to enter force early 2024
  • Deal increases ambitions on recycling
  • Aluminium and synthetic graphite added to key minerals
翻译:概括：
  • 重要矿产法可能于 2024 年初生效
  • 交易增加了回收的雄心
  • 铝和合成石墨添加到关键矿物中

Negotiators for EU governments and lawmakers reached a deal on Monday on targets for domestic supply of critical minerals such as lithium and nickel to reduce its reliance on third countries, principally China.翻译:欧盟各国政府谈判代表和立法者周一就锂和镍等关键矿产的国内供应目标达成协议，以减少对第三国（主要是中国）的依赖。

The European Commission proposed the Critical Raw Materials Act in March, a centrepiece of EU strategy to allow it to compete with the United States and China in making clean tech products.翻译:欧盟委员会于三月份提出了《关键原材料法案》，这是欧盟战略的核心，旨在使其能够在清洁技术产品的制造方面与美国和中国竞争。

The proposal said the European Union should extract 10%, recycle 15% and process 40% of its annual needs by 2030 for 16 "strategic raw materials".翻译:该提案称，到2030年，欧盟应提取10%、回收15%并加工16种“战略原材料”年度需求的40%。

The European Parliament and the Council, the grouping of EU governments, needed to agree on a common text. They did this on Monday, parties from both sides said, paving the way for the law to enter force in early 2024.翻译:欧洲议会和理事会（欧盟各国政府组成的组织）需要就共同文本达成一致。双方表示，他们于周一这样做了，为该法律于 2024 年初生效铺平了道路。

Negotiators upgraded the recycling target to at least 25%. Parliament negotiators also said the European Commission would pass a related act in 2027 that set a recycling target related to annual waste collected, rather than consumption.翻译:谈判人员将回收目标提高到至少 25%。议会谈判代表还表示，欧盟委员会将在 2027 年通过一项相关法案，设定与每年收集的废物相关的回收目标，而不是消费量。

The negotiators also agreed to add aluminium to the list of strategic raw materials as well as synthetic graphite. Natural graphite was already in the list.翻译:谈判代表还同意将铝以及合成石墨添加到战略原材料清单中。天然石墨已经在名单中。

The latter inclusion reflects China's plan to tighten export controls for graphite. China refines over 90% of the world's graphite into material that is used in almost all electric vehicle anodes, the negatively charged portion of the battery.翻译:后者的列入反映了中国计划加强石墨出口管制。中国将全球 90% 以上的石墨精炼成几乎所有电动汽车阳极（电池的带负电部分）所用的材料。

The EU is also heavily reliant on China for rare earths and lithium, other vital materials for its green transition.翻译:欧盟还严重依赖中国的稀土和锂以及其他绿色转型的重要材料。

The act's aim is that no third country should provide more than 65% of any strategic raw material, which also includes cobalt, copper, magnesium and titanium.翻译:该法案的目标是，任何第三国都不得提供超过 65% 的战略原材料，其中还包括钴、铜、镁和钛。

The act sets time limits on granting permits for strategic mining, recycling and processing projects, and requires large companies needing strategic materials in key technologies to do regular risk assessments of their supply chains.翻译:该法案规定了授予战略采矿、回收和加工项目许可证的时间限制，并要求需要关键技术中战略材料的大公司定期对其供应链进行风险评估。

It also has provisions designed to moderate consumption.翻译:它还制定了旨在调节消费的规定。

EU industry chief Thierry Breton said in a statement that, without action, Europe risked shortages and unwanted dependencies, and that the law would ensure high environmental and social standards.翻译:欧盟工业负责人蒂埃里·布雷顿(Thierry Breton)在一份声明中表示，如果不采取行动，欧洲将面临短缺和不必要的依赖的风险，而该法律将确保高环境和社会标准。

The bloc will work with EU members to identify strategic projects that will benefit from shorter and more efficient permitting procedures and easier access to finance, he added.翻译:他补充说，欧盟将与欧盟成员国合作，确定战略项目，这些项目将受益于更短、更高效的许可程序和更容易获得融资。

Reporting by Foo Yun Chee and Philip Blenkinsop; Editing by David Goodman, Jan Harvey and Jonathan Oatis翻译:Foo Yun Chee 和 Philip Blenkinsop 的报道；编辑：大卫·古德曼、扬·哈维和乔纳森·奥蒂斯

item.title: 美国表示正在努力在APEC领导人宣言上达成强有力的共识
item.description:
The United States is working hard to try to get a strong consensus leaders' statement at this week's Asia Pacific Economic Cooperation forum (APEC) summit this week, the senior U.S. official for APEC, Matt Murray, told reporters on Monday.翻译:美国亚太经合组织高级官员马特·默里周一对记者表示，美国正在努力争取在本周举行的亚太经济合作论坛（APEC）峰会上达成强有力的共识领导人声明。

Leaders from the 21-member APEC forum are due to gather in San Francisco from Wednesday until Friday. The wars in the Middle East and Ukraine have divided opinion among APEC members, making drafting a summit declaration difficult.翻译:由 21 个成员组成的 APEC 论坛领导人将于周三至周五齐聚旧金山。中东和乌克兰战争导致APEC成员意见分歧，给峰会宣言的起草带来困难。

"We're certainly working toward having a strong consensus statement in APEC for the leaders to be able to release at the end of the week," Murray said in a briefing call, while acknowledging there had been "a lot of friction over the last couple of years over statements, primarily due to the Russia-Ukraine conflict."翻译:默里在一次新闻发布会上表示：“我们当然正在努力在亚太经合组织会议上达成强有力的共识声明，以便领导人能够在本周末发布。”他同时承认“过去一段时间存在很多摩擦”。多年来的声明，主要是由于俄罗斯和乌克兰的冲突。”

"But last year Thailand hosted APEC and was able to announce a consensus leaders’ declaration, and we certainly want to try to do the same thing this year," Murray said.翻译:“但去年泰国主办了亚太经合组织，并能够宣布领导人共识宣言，我们当然希望今年尝试做同样的事情，”穆雷说。

"And we're working very hard with all of our like-minded partners and economies, economic partners throughout APEC, to try to deliver that kind of result."翻译:“我们正在与所有志同道合的伙伴和经济体、整个亚太经合组织的经济伙伴努力合作，努力实现这样的结果。”

Russia is a member of APEC and last year in Bangkok leaders endorsed a text vowing to uphold and strengthen a rules-based multilateral trading system while noting "most" of them condemned Russia's war in Ukraine.翻译:俄罗斯是亚太经合组织成员，去年领导人在曼谷签署了一份文本，誓言维护和加强基于规则的多边贸易体系，同时指出“大多数”领导人谴责俄罗斯在乌克兰的战争。

This year the war in the Middle East is an added complication with Muslim majority APEC members Indonesia and Malaysia, for example, backing the Palestinian cause, while the United States and others lean toward Israel.翻译:今年的中东战争变得更加复杂，例如，穆斯林占多数的亚太经合组织成员国印度尼西亚和马来西亚支持巴勒斯坦事业，而美国和其他国家则倾向于以色列。

The United State as host is in charge of the APEC guest list and says Russian President Vladimir Putin will not be attending the San Francisco summit. Murray said Russia would be represented by a deputy prime minister and other officials not subject to U.S. sanctions.翻译:美国作为东道主负责亚太经合组织嘉宾名单，并表示俄罗斯总统普京将不会出席旧金山峰会。默里表示，俄罗斯将由一名副总理和其他不受美国制裁的官员代表。

APEC accounts for about 62% of global GDP and almost half of global trade. It is unique in grouping economies rather than nations, allowing participation of Chinese-ruled Hong Kong and democratically governed Taiwan, which China claims as its own. It does not, however, include India, the world's most populous country.翻译:APEC约占全球GDP的62%，几乎占全球贸易的一半。它的独特之处在于将经济体而不是国家分组，允许中国统治的香港和民主统治的台湾参与其中，中国声称台湾是自己的领土。然而，它不包括世界上人口最多的国家印度。

Murray said India would be represented at ministerial-level APEC meetings this week as a "guest economy."翻译:穆雷表示，印度将作为“客座经济体”出席本周的亚太经合组织部长级会议。

Reporting by David Brunnstrom and Simon Lewis; editing by Jonathan Oatis翻译:大卫·布伦斯特罗姆和西蒙·刘易斯报道；乔纳森·奥蒂斯编辑

item.title: 英国审查对外国收购的审查
item.description:
Britain is reviewing how it screens foreign takeovers for national security concerns to reduce the burden on businesses, less than two years after tougher rules were introduced, deputy prime minister Oliver Dowden said on Monday.翻译:英国副首相奥利弗·道登周一表示，在出台更严格的规定不到两年后，英国正在审查如何出于国家安全考虑筛选外国收购，以减轻企业负担。

The government, under the 2022 National Security and Investment Act, has the power to scrutinise investment and take action to protect assets that are vital to Britain's national security.翻译:根据《2022 年国家安全和投资法案》，政府有权审查投资并采取行动保护对英国国家安全至关重要的资产。

Companies, however, have criticised the breadth of the act, which requires the notification of deals in 17 areas, ranging from advanced materials to transport.翻译:然而，公司批评了该法案的广度，该法案要求通报从先进材料到运输等 17 个领域的交易。

In the first full year of the act coming into effect, China-linked takeovers accounted for eight of the 15 interventions made, prompting criticism from the Chinese embassy in London.翻译:该法案生效的第一年，15 项干预措施中， 有8 项是与中国相关的收购，这引发了中国驻伦敦大使馆的批评。

Notably, the law was used to force Chinese-owned technology company Nexperia to sell Britain's biggest microchip factory, Newport Wafer Fab, which it had bought in 2021.翻译:值得注意的是，该法律被用来迫使中国科技公司 Nexperia 出售其于 2021 年收购的英国最大的微芯片工厂 Newport Wafer Fab。

Dowden said he needed to ensure the screening powers remained "up to date, proportionate and transparent", while protecting national security.翻译:道登表示，他需要确保筛查权力保持“最新、适当和透明”，同时保护国家安全。

Semiconductors and critical minerals could be carved out as standalone sectors under the act, he said, reflecting their growing importance.翻译:他说，根据该法案，半导体和关键矿物可以被划分为独立的部门，这反映出它们日益增长的重要性。

He said businesses, investors and advisors would now be consulted to ensure the process remained as frictionless and effective as possible.翻译:他表示，现在将咨询企业、投资者和顾问，以确保这一过程尽可能保持无摩擦和有效。

Evidence can be submitted to the government until Jan. 15.翻译:证据可以在 1 月 15 日之前提交给政府。

"The best way to foster economic security is through a strong and open economy," Dowden said. "That's why we've been using the powers effectively so far, only intervening when absolutely necessary to protect national security."翻译:道登说：“促进经济安全的最佳途径是通过强大和开放的经济。” “这就是为什么我们迄今为止一直有效地使用这些权力，只有在绝对必要时才进行干预以保护国家安全。”

Reporting by Paul Sandle; Editing by Susan Fenton翻译:保罗·桑德尔报道；苏珊·芬顿编辑

item.title: 托克将澳大利亚开采的铜带回中国——消息人士
item.description:
Summary:
  • Standard Australian copper concentrate shipment en route to China
  • Trafigura unit to assist with customs clearance
  • Entry of the cargo points to end of informal ban
翻译:概括：
  • 标准澳大利亚铜精矿运往中国
  • 托克部门协助清关
  • 货运点进入以结束非正式禁令

Swiss commodity trader Trafigura has agreed to help Chinese smelters clear imports of copper concentrate from Australia, suggesting an informal ban has been lifted if the cargo clears customs, three sources familiar with the matter told Reuters.翻译:三名知情人士告诉路透社，瑞士大宗商品贸易商托克已同意帮助中国冶炼厂清关从澳大利亚进口的铜精矿，这表明如果货物清关，非正式禁令将被解除。

China has gradually been easing a raft of unofficial curbs and tariffs on Australian imports, including copper concentrate and coal, that were imposed in 2020 at the height of a diplomatic spat over trade and security.翻译:中国正在逐步放松对澳大利亚进口商品（包括铜精矿和煤炭）的一系列非正式限制和关税，这些限制和关税是在 2020 年贸易和安全外交争端最严重时实施的。

Despite a wider informal easing, state-owned Chinese smelters that turn concentrate into copper metal, have been reluctant to buy from Australia, which accounted for 5%, or 1.1 million tonnes, of China's total copper concentrate imports in 2019.翻译:尽管有更广泛的非正式宽松政策，但将精矿转变成金属铜的中国国有冶炼厂一直不愿从澳大利亚购买，澳大利亚占2019年中国铜精矿进口总量的5%，即110万吨。

However a shipment of around 10,000 metric tonnes of copper concentrate mined from Western Australia's Golden Grove, owned by 29Metals (29M.AX), is on its way to Shandong province, where many major Chinese smelters are located, the sources said.翻译:然而，消息人士称，29Metals (29M.AX)旗下西澳大利亚 Golden Grove 开采的约 10,000 吨铜精矿正在运往中国许多主要冶炼厂所在地的山东省。

The passage of a large cargo of Australian concentrate through customs in China will ease smelters' concerns about a political backlash, the sources said.翻译:消息人士称，大批澳大利亚精矿通过中国海关将缓解冶炼厂对政治反弹的担忧。

"We have been waiting for others to be the first to resume buying Australia-origin concentrate," a source at a major Chinese copper concentrates importer said.翻译:“我们一直在等待其他人率先恢复购买澳大利亚原产精矿，”中国一家主要铜精矿进口商的消息人士表示。

Copper is vital for the power industry due to its conductivity. China consumes nearly half of the global mined copper supply estimated at around 25 million tonnes this year.翻译:由于其导电性，铜对于电力工业至关重要。中国今年消耗了全球矿铜供应量的近一半，估计约为 2500 万吨。

Trafigura's Chinese affiliate will be responsible for clearing customs on behalf of domestic consumers once the cargo arrives at Shandong's Qingdao port, two of the sources said.翻译:两名消息人士称，一旦货物抵达山东青岛港，托克的中国子公司将负责代表国内消费者清关。

"Once Trafigura gets the clearance, it is official that the soft ban has come to an end," the source added.翻译:消息人士补充道：“一旦托克获得许可，软禁令就正式结束。”

Trafigura declined to comment. 29Metals did not respond to a request for comment.翻译:托克拒绝置评。 29Metals 没有回应置评请求。

Australian trade data shows exports worth A$60.5 million ($38.52 million) of copper ore and concentrate to China in January.翻译:澳大利亚贸易数据显示，1 月份向中国出口了价值6050 万澳元（合 3852 万美元）的铜矿石和精矿。

However, the cargo was not logged in Chinese data, which officially shows that in the first nine months of this year, only $10 worth of copper ore and concentrate were imported.翻译:然而，中国数据并未记录这批货物，官方数据显示，今年前9个月，仅进口了价值10美元的铜矿石和精矿。

Australia produced 818,800 tonnes of copper in ore and concentrates last year and is, according International Copper Study Group, the world's eighth-largest producer of the metal.翻译:据国际铜业研究组织称，澳大利亚去年以矿石和精矿的形式生产了 818,800 吨铜，是世界第八大金属生产国。

The shipments from Australia come at a critical time, when Chinese smelters are starting annual negotiations with major miners on annual treatment charges and refining charges (TC/RC).翻译:来自澳大利亚的发货正值关键时刻，当时中国冶炼厂正开始与主要矿商就年度处理费和精炼费（TC/RC）进行年度谈判。

TC/RC is the income received by smelters for turning concentrates into refined copper, which typically rises with higher supply and falls during times of shortages.翻译:TC/RC 是冶炼厂将精矿转化为精炼铜所获得的收入，通常随着供应量的增加而增加，并在短缺时减少。

($1 = 1.5706 Australian dollars)翻译:(1 美元 = 1.5706 澳元)

Reporting by Julian Luk; Editing by Veronica Brown and Sharon Singleton翻译:Julian Luk 报道；维罗妮卡·布朗和莎朗·辛格尔顿编辑

item.title: 向太平洋提供安置方案是澳大利亚战胜中国的胜利
item.description:
Australia scored a significant win for influence in the Pacific Islands region with a trump card that China, seeking to expand security ties, doesn't have: the opportunity of resettlement.翻译:澳大利亚凭借一张寻求扩大安全关系的中国所没有的王牌，在太平洋岛屿地区的影响力上取得了重大胜利：重新安置的机会。

Under a security guarantee to the remote atoll nation of Tuvalu, which is threatened by rising sea levels, Australia will offer permanent residency to 280 Tuvalu citizens each year.翻译:根据对受到海平面上升威胁的偏远环礁国家图瓦卢的安全保障，澳大利亚每年将向 280 名图瓦卢公民提供永久居留权。

The treaty, signed on Friday by Prime Minister Anthony Albanese and his counterpart Kausea Natano, could transform Australia's relationship with the Pacific, analysts say.翻译:分析人士称， 该条约由总理安东尼·阿尔巴内塞和总理考西亚·纳塔诺于周五签署，可能会改变澳大利亚与太平洋地区的关系。

"It is something China can't do," said Australian National University Pacific expert Graeme Smith.翻译:“这是中国做不到的，”澳大利亚国立大学太平洋分校专家格雷姆·史密斯说。

The treaty was announced after parliament recently passed legislation for a wider scheme offering permanent settlement for 3,000 Pacific Islanders annually in a ballot from next year.翻译:该条约是在议会最近通过立法制定一项更广泛的计划后宣布的，该计划从明年开始每年投票为 3,000 名太平洋岛民提供永久定居。

Defence Minister Richard Marles called the treaty with Tuvalu a "watershed in our relationship with the Pacific", representing a "much greater commitment for Australia to be providing more of Tuvalu's defence".翻译:国防部长理查德·马尔斯称与图瓦卢的条约是“我们与太平洋地区关系的分水岭”，代表“澳大利亚为图瓦卢提供更多防务做出了更大的承诺”。

The sequencing of Albanese's whirlwind of diplomatic visits - Washington, Beijing a week later, and then directly to a Pacific Islands leaders meeting in Rarotonga, sent "clear signals to everyone involved", said Peter Dean, director of foreign policy and defence at the United States Studies Centre in Sydney.翻译:联合国外交政策和防务主任彼得·迪恩表示，阿尔巴尼亚旋风式的外交访问——一周后访问华盛顿、北京，然后直接前往拉罗汤加举行太平洋岛屿领导人会议，向所有相关人员发出了“明确的信号”。悉尼国家研究中心。

"The number one strategic objective of Australian governments since federation in this region has been to ensure another great power whose interests are not aligned to its own doesn't get a foothold in the region," he said.翻译:他说：“自该地区联邦成立以来，澳大利亚政府的首要战略目标就是确保另一个与其利益不一致的大国无法在该地区立足。”

"China can turn up and offer more infrastructure money... they can't turn up and offer this kind of resettlement relationship. It serves as a model for the region."翻译:“中国可以出现并提供更多的基础设施资金……他们不能出现并提供这种安置关系。它可以成为该地区的典范。”

Despite the improved diplomatic tone between Australia and China after Albanese's tour last week, the first in seven years by an Australian leader, security tensions remain as Beijing expands its role in the Pacific Islands.翻译:尽管阿尔巴内斯上周出访（澳大利亚领导人七年来首次出访）后，澳大利亚和中国之间的外交气氛有所改善，但随着北京扩大其在太平洋岛屿的作用，安全紧张局势依然存在。

Australia has sent 450 police and military officers to Solomon Islands, which signed a security pact with China last year, to provide security for the Pacific Games which open on Sunday, joining regional forces from Fiji and Papua New Guinea, to ensure there is no gap for Chinese police to fill.翻译:澳大利亚已向去年与中国签署安全协议的所罗门群岛派遣了 450 名警察和军官，为周日开幕的太平洋运动会提供安全保障，并与斐济和巴布亚新几内亚的地区部队一道，确保不存在任何差距。供中国警方填写。

Australia also will be able to block any policing deal between China and Tuvalu - as well as any telecommunications, energy or port deal - under its treaty.翻译:根据其条约，澳大利亚还可以阻止中国与图瓦卢之间的任何警务协议以及任何电信、能源或港口协议。

State-owned China Civil Engineering Construction Corporation (CCECC) had built Tuvalu's harbour in 2019, to the concern of diplomatic ally Taiwan which lost Solomon Islands and Kiribati to Beijing's overtures in the same year.翻译:国有的中国土木工程建设公司（CCECC）于 2019 年建造了图瓦卢港口，这引起了外交盟友台湾的担忧，台湾在同年因北京的示好而失去了所罗门群岛和基里巴斯。

"The game is not going to pause because Australia and China relations are a bit warmer, or even if China-U.S. competition somehow diminishes a bit," said Smith.翻译:史密斯表示：“比赛不会因为澳大利亚和中国关系回暖而暂停，或者即使中美竞争在某种程度上减弱。”

Wang Yiwei, an international relations professor at the Renmin University in Beijing, said rivalry between China and the United States in the Pacific Islands, with each seeking to block the other, had heightened Australia's sensitivity to every Chinese move.翻译:北京人民大学国际关系教授王义伟表示，中美在太平洋岛屿上的竞争，双方都试图阻止对方，这提高了澳大利亚对中国一举一动的敏感度。

The "strategic game" between China and the U.S. was now on Australia's doorstep, he said.翻译:他说，中美之间的“战略博弈”现在已经到了澳大利亚家门口。

"Cooperation in the Pacific region tends to focus on non-traditional security, including maintenance of public security and infrastructure to deal with climate change," he added.翻译:他补充说：“太平洋地区的合作往往侧重于非传统安全，包括维护公共安全和应对气候变化的基础设施。”

"These should not be considered too security-related, but the United States is still relatively sensitive, and Australia is also more sensitive."翻译:“这些不应该被认为太与安全相关，但美国还是比较敏感的，澳大利亚也比较敏感。”

Reporting by Kirsty Needham in Sydney and Martin Pollard in Beijing; Editing by Miral Fahmy翻译:悉尼的 Kirsty Needham 和北京的 Martin Pollard 报道；米拉尔·法赫米编辑

item.title: 埃赫曼押注锂，加大对大型矿山的投资
item.description:
Eramet (ERMT.PA) will go ahead with plans to add more capacity in Argentina for the battery mineral lithium and aims to double nickel mine output in Indonesia, in an investment push it sees withstanding a faltering global economy.翻译:Eramet (ERMT.PA)将继续实施在阿根廷增加电池矿物锂产能的计划，并计划将印度尼西亚的镍矿产量增加一倍，该公司认为，在全球经济步履蹒跚的情况下，这是一项投资举措。

The French mining group forecast on Monday capital expenditure of about 1.9 billion euros ($2.03 billion) over 2024-2026, an increase in annual investment from 550 million euros expected this year.翻译:法国矿业集团周一预测，2024-2026 年的资本支出约为 19 亿欧元（20.3 亿美元），比今年预期的 5.5 亿欧元增加了年度投资。

"These investments are being made in areas with very high growth," Christel Bories, Eramet's chair and CEO, told Reuters. "Lithium is not tied to world economic growth, it's tied to the development of batteries and the energy transition."翻译:埃赫曼董事长兼首席执行官克里斯特尔·博里斯 (Christel Bories) 告诉路透社：“这些投资是在增长非常快的领域进行的。” “锂与世界经济增长无关，它与电池的发展和能源转型有关。”

The group said it had approved a second phase for its Centenario lithium project in Argentina to produce about 30,000 metric tons annually of lithium carbonate equivalent (LCE), on top of the 24,000 tons targeted in a first tranche that will enter production in the second quarter of 2024.翻译:该集团表示，已批准其位于阿根廷的 Centenario 锂项目第二阶段，每年生产约 30,000 吨碳酸锂当量 (LCE)，第一阶段的目标产量为 24,000 吨，将于第二季度投入生产2024 年。

As well as studying a possible third tranche at Centenario, the firm is exploring the nearby Arizaro deposit, Bories said before Eramet's first capital markets day.翻译:Bories 在 Eramet 首个资本市场日之前表示，除了研究 Centenario 可能的第三批矿藏外，该公司还在勘探附近的 Arizaro 矿床。

Eramet is developing Centenario with Chinese steel giant Tsingshan. A $400 million deal with Glencore (GLEN.L) to market lithium from the project's first stage will mostly cover Eramet's financing needs for the next tranche, Bories said.翻译:Eramet 正在与中国钢铁巨头青山钢铁共同开发 Centenario。 Bories 表示，与 Glencore (GLEN.L)达成的一项价值 4 亿美元的协议，用于销售该项目第一阶段的锂，将主要满足 Eramet 下一阶段的融资需求。

In Chile, meanwhile, the group said it had acquired for an initial $95 million a 120,000-hectare lithium concession in the Atacama region.翻译:与此同时，在智利，该集团表示已以 9500 万美元的初始价格收购了阿塔卡马地区 12 万公顷的锂矿特许权。

Eramet wants to bring output at Weda Bay in Indonesia, the world's largest nickel mine that it also operates with Tsingshan, to 60 million wet metric tons in 2026 from 30 million anticipated this year.翻译:埃赫曼希望将印度尼西亚 Weda Bay 的产量从今年预计的 3,000 万湿吨增至 2026 年。Weda Bay 是该公司与青山共同运营的全球最大镍矿。

The group aims to process some of the Weda Bay ore into battery-grade nickel and cobalt in a joint venture with German chemical group BASF (BASFn.DE), with a decision due next year.翻译:该集团计划与德国化工集团巴斯夫(BASFn.DE)成立合资企业，将韦达湾的部分矿石加工成电池级镍和钴，并将于明年做出决定。

It also plans to increase ore output in Gabon, where it operates the world's largest manganese mine, to 8.5 million tons in 2026 from about 7 million expected in 2023, mainly through improvements to a rail transport link.翻译:该公司还计划主要通过改善铁路运输线路，将加蓬的矿石产量从 2023 年预计的约 700 万吨增加到 2026 年的 850 万吨。该公司在加蓬运营着世界上最大的锰矿。

The competitiveness of its top mines and the sale of less profitable metallurgical businesses allows Eramet to invest in a weaker cycle marked by economic uncertainty in commodity powerhouse China, Bories said.翻译:博里斯表示，其顶级矿山的竞争力以及利润较低的冶金业务的出售，使埃赫曼能够在大宗商品大国中国经济不确定性的疲软周期中进行投资。

"The outlook for 2024 is not very favourable," she said. "But despite the very sharp fall in metal prices we are managing to hold up."翻译:“2024 年的前景不太乐观，”她说。 “但尽管金属价格大幅下跌，我们仍设法坚持住。”

However, in New Caledonia its nickel subsidiary SLN remains in financial difficulties, and has entered another court conciliation process after using up the latest loan from the French government, Bories said.翻译:然而，Bories 表示，其在新喀里多尼亚的镍子公司 SLN 仍面临财务困难，并在用完法国政府的最新贷款后已进入另一场法院调解程序。

With Eramet refusing to inject more money into SLN and Glencore only providing funding to end-February for the Koniambo Nickel SAS (KNS) operation it co-owns, the authorities need to agree measures in the coming weeks to salvage a nickel industry depleted by energy costs and political tensions, she said.翻译:由于 Eramet 拒绝向 SLN 注入更多资金，而嘉能可仅在 2 月底前为其共同拥有的 Koniambo Nickel SAS (KNS) 业务提供资金，当局需要在未来几周内就拯救能源枯竭的镍行业达成一致。她说，成本和政治紧张局势。

Reporting by Gus Trompiz, Editing by Charlotte Van Campenhout and Louise Heavens翻译:格斯·特罗姆皮兹报道，夏洛特·范坎彭豪特和路易丝·天堂编辑

item.title: 随着北京加强做市计划，Citadel 证券探索中国牌照
item.description:
Citadel Securities, one of the world's biggest market-making firms, is "actively exploring" establishing a licensed onshore business in China, its chief executive Peng Zhao said.翻译:Citadel 证券首席执行官赵鹏表示，Citadel 证券是全球最大的做市商之一，正在“积极探索”在中国建立持牌境内业务。

If Citadel Securities were to obtain a licence, it would be the first foreign firm to formally foray into market-making in China outside interbank and foreign exchange market making.翻译:如果 Citadel 证券获得牌照，它将成为除银行间和外汇做市之外第一家正式涉足中国做市业务的外国公司。

Over the last two years, Chinese authorities have encouraged the development of market makers, approving more licences and pledging to roll out more types of derivatives as they seek to boost liquidity and draw in more long-term capital.翻译:过去两年，中国当局鼓励做市商的发展，批准了更多牌照，并承诺推出更多类型的衍生品，以提高流动性并吸引更多长期资本。

At least 16 domestic securities brokerage firms have been given the nod to act as market makers in China A shares as of mid-September, official records show.翻译:官方记录显示，截至9月中旬，至少有16家国内券商获准担任中国A股做市商。

"We are pleased to see the introduction of the market-making program in China," Zhao told Reuters in an interview in Hong Kong. He declined to disclose the specific licence the company might seek.翻译:“我们很高兴看到中国推出做市计划，”赵在香港接受路透社采访时表示。他拒绝透露该公司可能寻求的具体许可。

"As the Chinese capital market continues to grow beyond simple stock trading and into more complex products, the concept of market making not only will come naturally but also becomes necessary instead of just adding value from a liquidity perspective," Zhao said.翻译:“随着中国资本市场不断从简单的股票交易发展到更复杂的产品，做市的概念不仅会自然而然地出现，而且变得必要，而不仅仅是从流动性角度增加价值，”赵说。

Billionaire Ken Griffin's Citadel Securities, which handles about $390 billion in trades per day, is one of the top market makers by trading volume in the United States.翻译:亿万富翁 Ken Griffin 的 Citadel 证券每天处理约 3900 亿美元的交易，是美国交易量最大的做市商之一。

Market makers quote both buy and sell prices for assets and are constant trading participants in the market, earning profit through the spread of bid and offer prices.翻译:做市商提供资产的买入和卖出价格，并且是市场上的持续交易参与者，通过买入价和卖出价的价差赚取利润。

China's nascent market-making sector could grow to be worth 250 billion yuan ($34 billion) in revenues in 2032, compared with an estimated 40 billion yuan last year, according to Chinese brokerage Haitong.翻译:据中国券商海通称，中国新兴的做市行业到 2032 年的收入可能会增长到 2500 亿元人民币（340 亿美元），而去年估计为 400 亿元人民币。

Market-making was first introduced in China in 2014. In February, Beijing started to allow licenced securities brokerage firms to act as market makers for its newest board Beijing Stock Exchange, following a similar move in May 2022 for its Nasdaq-style STAR Market.翻译:中国于 2014 年首次引入做市制度。今年 2 月，北京开始允许持牌证券经纪公司担任其最新主板北京证券交易所的做市商，继 2022 年 5 月在纳斯达克风格的科创板市场采取类似举措后。

Citadel Securities in July appointed Tony Tang, the former head of BlackRock's China business, to helm its China operations.翻译:Citadel 证券于 7 月任命贝莱德中国业务前负责人 Tony Tang 负责其中国业务。

In February, it became a "qualified foreign institutional investor" in China, a few months after the country allowed qualified foreign institutions to trade more broadly in domestic futures and options instruments.翻译:今年二月，在中国允许合格境外机构更广泛地进行国内期货和期权工具交易几个月后，该公司成为中国的“合格境外机构投资者”。

The wider access it gained with that licence covers bonds, futures and options in addition to stocks it traded via China's Stock Connect Programme.翻译:除了通过中国股市互联互通计划交易的股票之外，该公司获得了更广泛的准入范围，涵盖债券、期货和期权。

This year, Citadel Securities also launched an investment-grade corporate bond market-making business in the United States. It is now looking to bring that business to Asia. Currently, it focuses on helping clients in Asia trade in U.S. assets such as U.S. Treasuries and U.S. dollar interest rate swaps.翻译:今年，Citadel 证券还在美国推出了投资级公司债券做市业务。该公司现在正寻求将该业务带到亚洲。目前，它专注于帮助亚洲客户进行美国国债和美元利率掉期等美国资产交易。

Since 2020, the brokerage has more than doubled its Asia Pacific headcount to nearly 300 people, a contrast to the wider trend of Wall Street layoffs amid depressed deal activity due to high interest rates and geopolitical uncertainty.翻译:自 2020 年以来，该券商的亚太区员工人数增加了一倍多，达到近 300 人，这与高利率和地缘政治不确定性导致交易活动低迷导致华尔街裁员的更广泛趋势形成鲜明对比。

Reporting by Summer Zhen and Selena Li in Hong Kong; Editing by Sumeet Chatterjee and Edwina Gibbs翻译:甄夏和李赛琳在香港的报道；苏米特·查特吉和埃德温娜·吉布斯编辑

item.title: 亚太经合组织经济增长将因持续通胀和中美紧张局势而放缓
item.description:
Economic growth among Asia Pacific Economic Cooperation countries is expected to decline next year and remain below the global average as higher interest rates slow U.S. growth, as China continues to struggle with its recovery and tensions between the two hamper trade, the body said on Sunday.翻译:亚太经合组织周日表示，由于美国经济增长放缓，中国继续在复苏中苦苦挣扎，以及两国之间的紧张关系阻碍了贸易，亚太经济合作组织国家的经济增长预计明年将下降，并仍低于全球平均水平。

The APEC Secretariat's Policy Support Unit issued new forecasts on the eve of the APEC leaders' summit in San Francisco, showing that the 21-country region's growth rate would dip to 2.8% in 2024 from 3.3% in 2023.翻译:APEC秘书处政策支持小组在旧金山APEC领导人峰会前夕发布新预测，显示21国地区的增长率将从2023年的3.3%降至2024年的2.8%。

The APEC GDP growth rate will average 2.9% in 2025 and 2026, below the global average of 3.2% and 3.5-3.6% in the rest of the world.翻译:2025年和2026年APEC GDP增长率平均为2.9%，低于全球平均水平3.2%和世界其他地区3.5-3.6%。

Among key downside risks for the Pacific Rim region are persistent inflation associated with export restrictions, weather conditions that have raised the price of rice and other agricultural products, and disruptions in the fertilizer supply chain. Taming inflation could require more monetary policy tightening, slowing growth further.翻译:环太平洋地区的主要下行风险包括与出口限制相关的持续通货膨胀、导致大米和其他农产品价格上涨的天气条件以及化肥供应链的中断。抑制通胀可能需要进一步收紧货币政策，从而进一步放缓经济增长。

Trade volume growth for goods is set to rebound next year among APEC countries after a largely flat 2023 due to China's sluggish growth, rising to 4.3% for goods exports and 3.5% for goods imports. But growth of both exports and imports are forecast to peak at 4.4% in 2025, declining slightly in 2026 due to geo-political fragmentation that is disrupting longstanding supply relationships.翻译:由于中国增长乏力，APEC 国家的货物贸易量增长在 2023 年基本持平后，明年将出现反弹，货物出口增长至 4.3%，货物进口增长至 3.5%。但预计出口和进口增长将在 2025 年达到 4.4% 的峰值，并在 2026 年因地缘政治分裂破坏长期供应关系而略有下降。

Carlos Kuriyama, director of the APEC policy support unit, said the data show that it was important for the U.S. and China to patch up their differences after years of tariff battles and national security export restrictions.翻译:APEC政策支持部门主任卡洛斯·栗山表示，数据显示，经过多年的关税战和国家安全出口限制，美国和中国弥合分歧非常重要。

U.S. President Joe Biden and Chinese President Xi Jinping are expected to meet in-person for the first time in a year on Wednesday in a high-stakes session aimed at curbing tensions between the world's two largest economies.翻译:美国总统乔·拜登和中国国家主席习近平预计将于周三举行一年来首次面对面会面，这是一场旨在遏制世界最大两个经济体之间紧张关系的高风险会议。

Kuriyama said that national security-driven export controls and other restrictions between the U.S. and China are driving up costs in supply chains that were previously optimized for efficiency. While a full return to pre-COVID-19 trading patterns is not possible, avoiding further fragmentation is important, he added.翻译:栗山表示，美国和中国之间以国家安全为导向的出口管制和其他限制正在推高供应链的成本，而此前这些供应链是为了提高效率而优化的。他补充说，虽然不可能完全恢复到 COVID-19 之前的交易模式，但避免进一步的碎片化很重要。

The data shows "how important it is to re-engage, de-risk and avoid decoupling" of the U.S. and Chinese economies. "I think a stable relationship within U.S. and China is a win-win situation for everyone," Kuriyama said.翻译:这些数据显示了中美经济“重新接触、降低风险和避免脱钩的重要性”。 “我认为中美之间稳定的关系对每个人来说都是双赢的局面，”栗山说。

Reporting by David Lawder Editing by Stephen Coates翻译:大卫·劳德报道 斯蒂芬·科茨编辑
